Trân trọng,

VietĐọc thêm

The trip was well organised. Ken was a great tour guide. He speaks English and is knowledgeable about Vietnam and its historical sites we have visited. This is actually the first time I have had someone explain the history to me. The lunch was nice and we got tea time too with local red wine or tea. Ken was an all around man, from picking me up at my hostel and dropping me off at the bus location to joking on the bus, telling interesting stories, leading the group and informing about next steps of the tour. He would give you the time you needed to be back too and checked in to make sure I was okay as I was travelling solo. He organised the tables on the boat so I was able to meet other people. 1st up we made a pitstop where they farm pearls. You get a little tour to explore, watch and learn about how farmer pearls are created.  2nd stop was the Halong harbour by taking the boat to the TopTip Island where you could hike up the mountain or chill on the beach, 3rd stop was the Hang Luon where you can take a bamboo boat or a kayak Id recommend the kayak if you have a friend but the boat if you are alone and no upper body strength! 4th was the hike on Hang Sung Sot where you visit the beautiful caves and Ken gives you story time and leads you through the cave. Tip: you can get a little keyring photo done for free to collect at the end. This trip is then finished off with happy hour and cocktails back to the bay during sunset. The boat is great and new with a warm pool to enjoy your drinks in whilst taking in the scenery or soaking up the sun on the roof deck. The day was beautiful, I made friends, took amazing photos and felt very safe in Kens hands. We arrived back at my hostel around 9pm so you really get your moneys worth. You have to pay extra for drinks but thats if you book with any company. You will get a bottle of water in the morning but I also brought my own refillable water bottle which was a good addition. Id say take your backpack with you to stops 2  3. You can leave it on the bus or boat for stops 1  4. They have cctv on the boat. Prices for drinks are more expensive than usual but there wont be many places where you can get them so just enjoy it! I got a coconut at stop 2 for 50k and its a sweet coconut which you can eat. Leave enough time as its a hard coconut so little bit of digging is required but its a lovely dessert! Overall, Id highly recommend it the tour and Ken!Read more
